bug.author: seilna
bug.summary: wandb.log information does not appear in wandb app when I initiate the engine with `wandb.init(reinit=True)`
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.15 Python version: 3.7.4 Operating System: Linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I used wandb.init(project='my project', reinit=True), because I want to launch multiple runs in single process. Then, I wrote the code so that each run logs its test performance as follows: for run in range(n_multiple_runs_with_different_setting): wandb.init(project='my project', reinit=True) # ... some training script ... test_performance = measure_acc(my_model, test_data) wandb.log({'performance': test_performance}) But I can't see any performance logged in my wandb app. It just shows some hyperparameters I set. If I fix the init code as wandb.init(project='my project', reinit=False), it successfully log its performance, but as you know, it only works at first run. Is this behavior intended? How I can do logging for multiple runs in single process?

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.63. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/seilna>@seilna</denchmark-link> if you run at the end of the loop it should work. We're working on improvements to this scenario.

Somehow I still get the following error after the first loop using wandb.join() <denchmark-code>OSError: [WinError 6] The handle is invalid wandb: ERROR W&B process (PID 19696) did not respond wandb: ERROR W&B process failed to launch, see: wandb\debug.log </denchmark-code>
